data.title: 25 Awesome Games Like Mafia III in 2024!
data.meta_description: Open-world crime dramas like Mafia III include Grand Theft Auto V, Red Dead Redemption 2, Saints Row IV, L.A. Noire, Sleeping Dogs, Watch Dogs, Watch Dogs 2, The Saboteur, Yakuza 0, Yakuza Kiwami and more!
data.text:
Dive deep into the gritty underworld: Discover thrilling games that capture the essence of Mafia III

Mafia III is an open-world action-adventure game that plunges players into the gritty world of 1968 New Bordeaux, a reimagined version of New Orleans. You take on the role of Lincoln Clay, an orphan and Vietnam War veteran who sets out on a brutal quest for vengeance against the Italian mob responsible for the slaughter of his surrogate family. The game is known for its deep storytelling, rich atmosphere, and a soundtrack filled with iconic 60s music. Everything from the intricate level design to the realistic character animations immerses you into a world teeming with corruption, betrayal, and savage combat.

If you enjoy Mafia III, there are several other open-world games brimming with action, intricate plots, and expansive environments that you might find equally captivating. Titles like Grand Theft Auto V offer a modern twist on the crime genre, while Red Dead Redemption 2 transports you to a sprawling Wild West adventure full of nuanced characters and moral dilemmas. Both games are renowned for their detailed world-building and freedom to explore diverse missions at your own pace. Other notable mentions include L.A. Noire, known for its detective-driven narrative and period-accurate setting, and Sleeping Dogs, which delivers martial arts-infused action in a vibrant Hong Kong backdrop.

But that's just the tip of the iceberg. For a full list of games like Mafia III that offer similar thrills and deep narrative experiences, you'll want to keep listening...

(I may earn a small commission from purchases through links in this article.)

25. Grand Theft Auto V

If you enjoyed the rich narrative and open-world mechanics of Mafia III, you're sure to find Grand Theft Auto V just as captivating. Both games feature expansive, immersive worlds that you can freely explore, providing countless activities and missions to engage in. GTA V's story mode follows three uniquely different protagonists, each with their own intricate storylines and backstories, much like how Mafia III dives deep into Lincoln Clay's quest for vengeance. The high level of detail in the environments and character development in GTA V mirrors the depth and authenticity that Mafia III offers, ensuring you get deeply involved in the storyline.

Additionally, both games excel in their approach to combat and mission variety. Whether it's pulling off a heist in GTA V or taking down mob bosses in Mafia III, the action scenes are exceptionally thrilling and strategically demanding. Each game offers a blend of stealth and full-on action combat, catering to different play styles. The vast array of vehicles you can drive and the customization options in GTA V are reminiscent of the vehicular freedom in Mafia III, which adds another layer of excitement and personal touch to your gameplay experience.

Grand Theft Auto V is available on PlayStation 4 & 5, Xbox One & Series X/S, and PC, typically priced around $30-$40 USD.

24. Red Dead Redemption 2

Red Dead Redemption 2 and Mafia III both deliver immersive, narrative-driven experiences where you step into the shoes of a complex protagonist navigating a rich and detailed world. In Red Dead Redemption 2, you play as Arthur Morgan, an outlaw wrestling with loyalty, morality, and survival in the waning days of the Wild West. Similarly, Mafia III puts you in the role of Lincoln Clay, a Vietnam War veteran seeking revenge against the Italian mob in the racially charged atmospheres of 1968 New Bordeaux. Both games blend storytelling with action, pulling you into their worlds with intricate plots and well-developed characters.

In terms of gameplay, both titles share open-world exploration, filled with dynamic environments and side activities that make the world feel alive. Red Dead Redemption 2 offers a vast, beautifully crafted world where you can engage in activities like hunting, fishing, and engaging in random encounters that add depth to the storyline. Mafia III, on the other hand, provides a gritty depiction of 1960s America, complete with car chases, shootouts, and various missions that allow you to take control of New Bordeaux. Both games offer a mix of stealth, combat, and strategy, ensuring that you always have a variety of gameplay mechanics to explore.

Red Dead Redemption 2 is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $59.99 USD.

23. Saints Row IV

If you enjoyed Mafia III for its action-packed open-world experience and gripping narrative, then Saints Row IV will certainly catch your interest as well. Similar to Mafia III, Saints Row IV offers an expansive open world filled with a variety of missions and side activities to keep you engaged for hours. Both games feature rich storytelling, although Saints Row IV leans more towards a humorous and over-the-top narrative than the serious tone found in Mafia III. The characters in Saints Row IV are just as memorable as those in Mafia III, often offering witty banter and unique personalities that add depth to the game.

Another similarity is the game's combat system. In Saints Row IV, much like in Mafia III, you'll engage in intense shootouts and hand-to-hand combat. Saints Row IV amps this up by introducing superpowers that allow for even more dynamic and explosive gameplay. Imagine combining the strategic cover-based shooting from Mafia III with the ability to leap over buildings, run faster than cars, and blast enemies with telekinetic force! Additionally, both games give you a plethora of customization options, from weapons and vehicles to character appearance, ensuring that your experience feels personal and tailored to your playstyle.

Saints Row IV is available on PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, Xbox 360, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $19.99 USD.

22. L.A. Noire

If you loved the immersive world and detailed storytelling of Mafia III, you'll definitely find a lot to love in L.A. Noire. Like Mafia III, L.A. Noire offers a rich, historically authentic settingâ€”in this case, the post-war 1940s Los Angelesâ€”allowing you to immerse yourself in a meticulously crafted world. Both games feature strong narratives with compelling characters, where you play as a law enforcement officer struggling with personal demons while trying to dispense justice.

In terms of gameplay, L.A. Noire shares many similarities with Mafia III. Both games offer an open-world experience where you can complete main missions and various side quests at your own pace. The action sequences are equally thrilling, with L.A. Noire providing a mix of car chases, shootouts, and unique investigative mechanics that involve gathering clues and solving cases. Like Mafia III, L.A. Noire balances its action-packed elements with thoughtful, narrative-driven moments, making it a well-rounded, captivating game.

L.A. Noire is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, and Microsoft Windows, typically priced around $39.99 USD.

21. Sleeping Dogs

If you enjoyed the gripping story and open-world experience of Mafia III, then Sleeping Dogs will be right up your alley. Both games offer a thrilling narrative set in a vibrant city. In Sleeping Dogs, you take on the role of Wei Shen, an undercover cop infiltrating the dangerous Triads in Hong Kong. Much like Mafia III's Lincoln Clay, Wei must navigate a perilous web of crime, loyalty, and betrayal, all while engaging in intense combat and challenging missions that keep the adrenaline pumping.

Another similarity lies in the strong emphasis on character development and atmospheric storytelling. Just as Mafia III immerses you in the 1960s New Bordeaux with its rich historical context and compelling characters, Sleeping Dogs pulls you into the culturally rich and bustling streets of Hong Kong. The game excels in creating a lived-in world filled with authentic sounds, vibrant markets, and a dynamic social environment. Whether you're taking down enemies in brutal hand-to-hand combat or engaging in high-speed chases, the city feels alive and reactive to your every move.

Sleeping Dogs is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $20 USD.

20. Watch Dogs

If you loved Mafia III, you're going to find a lot to enjoy in Watch Dogs. Both games offer an open-world experience with a rich narrative centered around a single protagonist taking on a corrupt system. In Watch Dogs, you play as Aiden Pearce, a skilled hacker waging a personal war in the bustling city of Chicago. Like Mafia III's Lincoln Clay, Aiden has his own unique set of skills that set him apart, using technology to manipulate the environment to his advantage. This element of strategy adds a fresh layer of complexity, reminiscent of planning your takeovers and navigating the criminal underworld in Mafia III.

Additionally, Watch Dogs brings a similar level of depth when it comes to its sandbox gameplay. The game world is filled with activities and side missions that allow you to immerse yourself fully in its gritty setting. Much like how New Bordeaux felt alive with its dynamic weather and interactions in Mafia III, Chicago in Watch Dogs presents a living, breathing world full of opportunities for exploration, whether itâ€™s uncovering hidden secrets or engaging in high-speed chases. The open-world design in both games encourages players to explore and approach objectives in multiple ways, adding hours of replayability and excitement.

Watch Dogs is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $19.99 USD.

19. Watch Dogs 2

If you loved Mafia III for its rich storytelling and open-world exploration set against a backdrop of social and political issues, Watch Dogs 2 should definitely be on your radar. Much like Mafia III, which dived deep into the cultural challenges of 1968 New Bordeaux, Watch Dogs 2 also offers a thought-provoking narrative but in a modern setting. Youâ€™ll be diving into the world of hacking and activism in a beautifully recreated San Francisco. The game focuses on themes like privacy, corporate control, and social justice, echoing the moral complexities you appreciated in Mafia III.

Both games emphasize a sandbox-style gameplay where you can choose how to tackle objectives, whether thatâ€™s through stealth, direct confrontation, or unique tactical approaches. In Watch Dogs 2, you'll find yourself employing a variety of tech tools and gadgets to manipulate the environment to your advantage, much like using strategy and different combat techniques in Mafia III. This dynamic approach to missions keeps the gameplay fresh and engaging, promising hours of entertainment and plenty of replay value.

Watch Dogs 2 is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $30 USD.

18. The Saboteur

In The Saboteur, much like in Mafia III, you'll find yourself immersed in an open-world environment teeming with rich narrative content and strategic gameplay. Instead of the post-Vietnam War setting of Mafia III, The Saboteur takes you to Nazi-occupied Paris during World War II. The game is filled with stealth missions, sabotage tasks, and combat sequences that will remind you of the strategic depth and action-packed moments you loved in Mafia III. Both games allow you to explore their respective worlds extensively, letting you experience the storyline at your own pace while offering plenty of side missions and activities to dive into.

Another key similarity is the strong focus on the protagonist's personal vendetta and the progression of their story. In The Saboteur, you play as Sean Devlin, a hard-edged Irishman who joins the French Resistance to avenge a personal loss and fight against the Nazis. Much like Lincoln Clay in Mafia III, Sean's journey is deeply personal, driven by revenge and justice, adding emotional weight to the missions and a greater sense of purpose to each action you take. Both titles excel in creating compelling characters and engaging narratives that pull you into their respective worlds.

The Saboteur is available on PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, and PC, typically priced around $19.99 USD.

17. Yakuza 0

When it comes to gripping narratives and rich atmospheres, Yakuza 0 and Mafia III both excel in immersing players in their respective worlds. Much like the gritty streets of New Bordeaux in Mafia III, Yakuza 0 transports you to the bustling districts of 1980s Tokyo and Osaka. In both games, you will find vivid, open-world environments brimming with life, from shady back alleys to vibrant nightlife. Engaging with diverse side missions and mini-games not only enriches the main storyline but also deepens your connection to the world and its characters.

Another major similarity is the focus on personal and cultural conflicts. In Mafia III, you took on the character of Lincoln Clay, out for revenge against the Italian mafia for betraying his surrogate family. Yakuza 0 presents you with two protagonists, Kazuma Kiryu and Goro Majima, both grappling with personal and professional dilemmas within the Japanese underworld. Both games weave complex tales of loyalty, betrayal, and redemption, creating emotionally charged narratives that keep you hooked from start to finish. The combat systems in both games also offer a satisfying blend of strategy and brawling, with Yakuza 0 providing an array of customizable fighting styles that keeps battles engaging and dynamic.

Yakuza 0 is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $19.99 USD.

16. Yakuza Kiwami

If you enjoyed Mafia III, you'll likely find Yakuza Kiwami equally engaging due to its rich narrative and immersive open-world gameplay. Both games feature gritty, realistic settings and a strong focus on crime and underworld themes. In Yakuza Kiwami, you step into the shoes of Kazuma Kiryu, a yakuza member navigating the treacherous streets of Kamurocho. Much like Lincoln Clay from Mafia III, Kiryu's journey is fraught with intense personal vendettas and a need to reclaim his place in a world that's trying to crush him.

Another similarity lies in the complex combat and mission structures of both games. Yakuza Kiwami offers a blend of hand-to-hand combat and weapon-based fighting, creating a thrilling experience reminiscent of Mafia IIIâ€™s diverse combat mechanics. Both games also include an array of side missions and mini-games, allowing players to delve deeper into their respective worlds. Yakuza Kiwami's intricately designed mini-games and engaging side quests are much like the side activities in Mafia III that provide a break from the main storyline and add hours of additional content.

Yakuza Kiwami is available on PlayStation 4, PlayStation 3, Xbox One, and Microsoft Windows, typically priced around $19.99 USD.

15. Yakuza: Like a Dragon

If you enjoyed Mafia III, you'll find Yakuza: Like a Dragon equally captivating with its rich storytelling and immersive world. Both games feature deeply engrossing narratives centered around crime, loyalty, and redemption. In Yakuza: Like a Dragon, you take on the role of Ichiban Kasuga, a low-ranking yakuza left for dead by the man he trusted the most. This echoes the emotional depth found in Mafia III, where Lincoln Clay seeks vengeance upon a mob family. The character development in both games is top-notch, making you invested in their journeys and hardships.

Another striking similarity is the atmospheric, open-world settings you get to explore. Yakuza: Like a Dragon offers a detailed and vibrant rendering of Yokohama, Japan, filled with side missions and activities, much like how Mafia III brings New Bordeaux to life with its own unique flavor. Both games also feature a mix of fierce combat and strategic planning. While Yakuza: Like a Dragon shifts to a turn-based battle system, it still delivers intense and rewarding gameplay. This change in combat mechanics adds a new layer of strategy, similar to how Mafia IIIâ€™s cover-based shooting requires tactical considerations.

Yakuza: Like a Dragon is available on PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, and PC, typically priced around $59.99 USD.

14. Just Cause 3

Just Cause 3 offers a thrilling open-world experience similar to what you enjoyed in Mafia III. Both games emphasize extensive exploration, packed with dynamic environments that react to your actions. Like Mafia III, where you take on the role of Lincoln Clay fighting against the Italian mob, Just Cause 3 places you in the shoes of Rico Rodriguez, challenging an oppressive dictator in the fictional Mediterranean island of Medici. The sense of purpose and intense action in an open-world setting creates an engaging narrative that keeps you hooked.

Another similarity is the diverse range of missions and activities that drive the gameplay forward. In Mafia III, you faced intense shootouts and meticulously planned takedowns. Just Cause 3 amplifies that exhilaration with incredibly diverse combat scenarios. You have access to a vast array of weapons and vehicles, as well as a unique grappling hook and parachute, significantly enhancing your freedom to approach missions creatively. Both games provide a sense of empowerment as you reshape the world around you through your actions, making each play session feel fresh and exciting.

Just Cause 3 is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $19.99 USD.

13. Just Cause 4

Just Cause 4 and Mafia III both immerse you in vibrant open-world environments filled with dynamic storytelling and intense action. In Just Cause 4, you're thrust into the heart of SolÃ­s, a South American paradise suffering under the rule of a ruthless paramilitary group. Similar to the rich narrative of Mafia III, where you navigate the intricate criminal underworld of New Bordeaux, Just Cause 4 offers a multifaceted storyline that keeps you engaged. The main protagonist, Rico Rodriguez, like Lincoln Clay, is a complex, tough-as-nails character with a deep personal mission, making both games emotionally resonant and deeply immersive.

Another notable similarity is the sheer freedom and creativity afforded to players. In Mafia III, you navigate the city using a variety of vehicles, strategize your takeovers, and choose how to dismantle your enemies. Just Cause 4 amplifies this open-world customization with even more adrenaline-pumping choices â€“ from hijacking jets and tanks to manipulating extreme weather to wreak havoc on your enemies. The gameâ€™s emphasis on explosive, over-the-top action will strike a chord with anyone who relished the tactical freedom and high-energy combat sequences in Mafia III.

Just Cause 4 is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $19.99 USD.

12. Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag

Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag offers a gripping open-world experience much like Mafia III, but with its unique setting rooted in the golden age of piracy. In both games, you're put in the shoes of a charismatic anti-hero navigating through a richly-detailed world filled with quests, treasures, and rival factions. Black Flag takes you on a journey across the Caribbean, where you'll command a pirate ship, gather treasures, and engage in naval warfare. Much like in Mafia III, the freedom to explore and the dynamic environments provide countless hours of immersive gameplay.

Both games also feature intricate narratives that explore themes of vengeance, loyalty, and survival. In Black Flag, you'll follow Edward Kenway, a pirate seeking to make his fortune and establish his legacy, mirroring some of the personal motivations and struggles of Lincoln Clay in Mafia III. The story is deepened with engaging side missions, from hunting animals to upgrading your ship, which offers a sense of progression and accomplishment similar to upgrading your criminal empire in Mafia III. You'll find the blend of action, stealth, and strategy in Black Flag to be as compelling and rewarding as the gameplay mechanics you loved in Mafia III.

Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag is available on multiple platforms including PS4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, and PC, typically priced around $20 USD.

11. Assassin's Creed Syndicate

If you loved the immersive, open-world experience of Mafia III, then Assassin's Creed Syndicate will definitely catch your interest. Both games focus on intricate, historical narratives combined with a rich, detailed environment. While Mafia III sets you in the gritty, racially tense 1960s New Bordeaux, Assassin's Creed Syndicate transports you to the foggy, bustling streets of Victorian London. The protagonists in both games are fighting to take down corrupt systems of power, promising a gripping storyline as you climb the ranks of organized crime or, in Syndicate's case, the clandestine Assassin Brotherhood.

In terms of gameplay, both titles offer an abundance of side missions and activities that complement the main story. In Mafia III, you take over districts and run rackets, building your criminal empire from the ground up. Assassin's Creed Syndicate shares this sense of progression; you liberate areas of London by overthrowing gang leaders, thereby expanding your influence. Additionally, both games feature an innovative combat system that balances strategic planning with visceral action. Whether it's Lincoln Clay's brutal takedowns or the Frye twins' agile combat techniques, you're in for engaging, action-packed gameplay.

Assassin's Creed Syndicate is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $19.99 USD.

10. Far Cry 4

If you loved Mafia III's gripping storyline and open-world exploration, you'll find Far Cry 4 incredibly captivating. Both games are immersive experiences set in expansive, open worlds filled with rich narratives and opportunities for exploration. In Far Cry 4, you play as Ajay Ghale, who returns to his homeland in the Himalayas and gets caught up in a violent civil war. Just like Lincoln Clay in Mafia III, Ajay has to navigate a war-torn environment, dealing with various factions, which adds an intricate layer of strategy and decision-making. The sense of immersion is heightened by the detailed environments and the living, breathing world that reacts to your decisions.

Both games offer a diverse range of missions and side quests, giving you plenty to do beyond the main storyline. Far Cry 4 shines with its combination of action-adventure elements and first-person shooting mechanics, mirroring the intense combat scenarios and strategic planning that Mafia III fans appreciate. The game also features a compelling cast of characters and a rich backstory, ensuring that every mission contributes to the larger narrative. Just like in Mafia III, your choices can affect the outcome of the game, providing a deeply personalized experience.

Far Cry 4 is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $19.99 USD.

9. Far Cry 5

If you enjoyed the gripping, open-world dynamic of Mafia III, you'll find a lot to love in Far Cry 5. Both games offer immersive storytelling with compelling narratives that grab your attention and donâ€™t let go. In Far Cry 5, you're up against a fanatical doomsday cult in the fictional Hope County, Montana, which echoes Mafia III's deep dive into the criminal underworld of New Bordeaux. The lush, sprawling environments encourage exploration and interaction, providing hours of gameplay filled with intense missions and side quests.

Another aspect that Far Cry 5 shares with Mafia III is its emphasis on character development and player choice. Whether you're dismantling a drug trade or freeing townsfolk from cult control, the decisions you make significantly impact the game's world, just like in Mafia III where your actions shape the fate of various factions. Additionally, both games emphasize a blend of stealth and action-packed combat, allowing you to tailor your approach to each mission and truly immerse yourself in a richly detailed, open-world environment.

Far Cry 5 is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $29.99 USD.

8. Far Cry 6

Both Far Cry 6 and Mafia III offer immersive open-world experiences where you navigate through richly detailed environments filled with enemies, missions, and side activities. If you enjoyed the gritty backdrop of New Bordeaux in Mafia III, you will appreciate the vibrant and hostile setting of Yara in Far Cry 6. The game's storyline also revolves around themes of resistance and overthrowing oppressive regimes, much like Lincoln Clay's quest for vengeance and justice in Mafia III. These thematic similarities ensure that if you were captivated by Mafia III's narrative, Far Cry 6 will offer a similarly engaging experience.

Another aspect these games share is their focus on combat and tactical gameplay. In Mafia III, you're immersed in intense, often brutal firefights and strategic takedowns, requiring a mix of stealth and raw firepower to succeed. Far Cry 6 picks up this exhilarating combat style, allowing you to plan your approachâ€”be it guns blazing or quietly taking down enemies. The arsenal of customizable weapons and vehicles adds an extra layer of excitement, mirroring the choices and strategies that made Mafia III so compelling. Additionally, both games emphasize character-driven plots where your relationship with key allies plays a pivotal role, thus deepening your emotional investment in the game world.

Far Cry 6 is available on multiple platforms, including PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, and PC, typically priced around $59.99 USD.

7. Tom Clancy's The Division

Tom Clancy's The Division shares a lot in common with Mafia III in terms of its gritty, immersive storytelling and its focus on an open-world experience. Like Mafia III, The Division places you in a richly detailed urban environment, this time set in post-pandemic New York City. You'll find yourself engaging in intense shootouts and tactical combat as you work to restore order in a city teetering on the brink of collapse. Just as you enjoyed exploring the atmospheric, crime-ridden streets of New Bordeaux in Mafia III, you'll appreciate the detailed urban sprawl of The Division with its dynamic weather systems and stunning visual effects.

Another aspect that makes The Division appealing if you liked Mafia III is the strong emphasis on character progression and customization. In Mafia III, you grew attached to Lincoln Clay and his quest for vengeance while upgrading your arsenal and abilities. The Division offers a similar sense of growth, allowing you to shape your character with various skills, weapons, and gear, each offering different strategic advantages. The RPG elements and loot system in The Division deepen your connection to your character and provide a rewarding sense of progression, much like what you experienced dismantling crime syndicates in Mafia III.

Tom Clancy's The Division is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $29.99 USD.

6. Tom Clancy's The Division 2

If you enjoyed the open-world setting and engaging storylines of Mafia III, you're in for a treat with Tom Clancy's The Division 2. The game offers a richly detailed world set in a near-future Washington D.C., teeming with life and challenges. Like Mafia III, The Division 2 immerses you in a gripping narrative, focusing on the collapse of society and the battle to restore order. You'll find yourself captivated by the story while navigating through a world filled with danger and unpredictable foes, similar to the challenges you faced in Mafia III's New Bordeaux.

The Division 2 also shares the same intense, third-person shooter mechanics that you loved in Mafia III. The cover-based combat system is intuitive and engaging, providing both strategic depth and adrenaline-pumping action. Just like Lincoln Clay, the protagonist in Mafia III, your character in The Division 2 has access to a wide array of weapons and gadgets, allowing you to customize your approach to each mission. The game's co-op play adds another layer of excitement, making missions even more dynamic and engaging, much like your solo exploits in Mafia III but with the added thrill of teaming up with friends.

Tom Clancy's The Division 2 is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $29.99 USD.

5. Mad Max

Mad Max and Mafia III share the exhilarating open-world experience that keeps you on the edge of your seat. Both games offer a vast, immersive environment ripe for exploration, filled with a variety of missions that keep the gameplay fresh and exciting. While Mafia III immerses you in the gritty, crime-ridden streets of 1968 New Bordeaux, Mad Max transports you to a desolate, post-apocalyptic wasteland where survival hinges on your ability to scavenge, build, and fight. The deep narrative in each game ensures that every action you take has a meaningful impact, whether you're toppling the Mafia empire or battling ruthless warlords for precious resources.

Additionally, the combat in both Mad Max and Mafia III is a massive highlight. In Mad Max, you'll find yourself engaging in brutal vehicular combat and intense hand-to-hand skirmishes, similar to the dynamic gunfights and strategic takedowns found in Mafia III. The customization options also parallel each other; as you progress, you'll have the opportunity to upgrade your vehicles and weapons, tailoring your gameplay experience to your style. The attention to detail in character and vehicle upgrades provides a satisfying sense of progression and empowerment in the face of overwhelming odds.

Mad Max is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $19.99 USD.

4. Hitman 2

Hitman 2 shares a lot of the exciting gameplay elements that made Mafia III such a hit. For starters, both games feature expansive, open-world environments that allow you to explore and interact with your surroundings in a dynamic way. You can approach your objectives with a high degree of freedom, deciding whether to be stealthy and methodical in your strategy or to take a more direct and aggressive approach. This offers you a lot of replayability, as you can explore different tactics and discover new areas each time you play. The intricate level design and rich, detailed settings in Hitman 2 will definitely remind you of the immersive world of Mafia III.

Another similarity is the strong focus on narrative-driven missions. Just like you became invested in the story of Lincoln Clay in Mafia III, you'll find yourself deeply engaged with Agent 47's missions in Hitman 2. Each mission in Hitman 2 is like a mini-drama with its own set of characters, storylines, and multiple ways to achieve your objectives. This makes every mission not just a series of tasks, but an immersive experience that keeps you invested in the game's plot and outcomes. Moreover, both games require you to strategically analyze your surroundings and make critical decisions that can impact how the story unfolds, which adds a layer of depth to the gameplay.

Hitman 2 is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $59.99 USD.

3. Hitman 3

In Hitman 3, much like in Mafia III, youâ€™ll find yourself deeply immersed in a vast and meticulously crafted open-world setting. Both games allow you to explore detailed environments filled with rich stories and characters that feel alive. While Mafia III focuses on the gritty world of organized crime in 1968 New Bordeaux, Hitman 3 brings you to various stunning locations around the globe, offering a tantalizing array of exotic and urban settings ripe for exploration. You'll find the satisfaction in both games from carefully planning your every move and utilizing the environment to your advantage, whether itâ€™s solving problems with brute force or with more cunning, strategic maneuvers.

Another compelling similarity between the two games is the depth and complexity of their missions. Just as Mafia III presents you with a variety of objectives that can be tackled in multiple waysâ€”be it stealthily sneaking around or going in guns blazingâ€”Hitman 3 provides you with a sandbox of possibilities for executing your targets. The freedom to choose your approach, use disguises, and make strategic decisions grants an unparalleled sense of agency and replayability. Both games are not just about completing missions, but about how creatively and effectively you can do so, offering rich, dynamic gameplay that keeps you engaged and eager to explore every corner of their worlds.

Hitman 3 is available on PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X/S, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $59.99 USD.

2. Scarface: The World is Yours

Scarface: The World is Yours offers a captivating open-world experience similar to what you enjoyed in Mafia III. Both games emphasize the journey of a protagonist rising to power in a world filled with crime and intrigue. In Scarface, you step into the shoes of Tony Montana, aiming to rebuild his empire after surviving the bloody assault on his mansion. Much like Lincoln Clay in Mafia III, Tony is driven by vengeance and a thirst for power, navigating through dangerous territories and recruiting allies to reclaim his authority. The rich narrative in both games ensures that you're not just playing to complete missions but engaging deeply in a gripping storyline filled with betrayal, ambition, and conflict.

Moreover, both games excel in presenting immersive, open-world environments filled with details that bring their respective eras to life. While Mafia III transports you to the racially charged late 1960s New Bordeaux, Scarface immerses you in the neon-soaked, drug-infused streets of 1980s Miami. The world in Scarface is just as dynamic and reactive as in Mafia III, with the playerâ€™s influence visibly altering the cityscape as you regain control of territories and businesses. The robust combat system in both games allows for intense firefights and strategic planning, ensuring that every encounter feels fresh and challenging. The open-world activities such as side missions, business management, and territory control add depth and replayability, making Scarface a great follow-up to your experience in Mafia III.

Scarface: The World is Yours is available on PlayStation 2, Xbox, and Microsoft Windows, typically priced around $30 USD.

1. Sleeping Dogs: Definitive Edition

If you enjoyed the immersive open-world experience of Mafia III, you'll feel right at home with Sleeping Dogs: Definitive Edition. Both games let you dive into rich, intricately-detailed urban environments; Mafia III takes you to the gritty streets of 1960s New Bordeaux, while Sleeping Dogs transports you to the vibrant Hong Kong underworld. Each game has a compelling narrative driven by strong storytelling and complex characters. You'll find yourself drawn into an engaging drama filled with crime, betrayal, and redemption as you navigate both cities and uncover hidden secrets.

Moreover, the gameplay mechanics offer a lot of similarities. In Mafia III, you had the freedom to approach missions using a blend of stealth, strategy, and brute force. Sleeping Dogs offers a comparable experience, with fluid hand-to-hand combat and a range of exciting missions that keep you on your toes. The vehicle mechanics are also finely tuned, giving you the chance to race through the city streets in high-speed chases and nail-biting escapades. Both games feature a variety of side activities that add depth and replayability, making sure the fun doesnâ€™t end with the main storyline.

Sleeping Dogs: Definitive Edition is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $29.99 USD.
